instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Macbook air 820-00165-A
threads.message:
Macbook air 820-00165-A
Charger showing green for 3-5 seconds,  then orange light. 
Drawing 0.118A on power supply

PPBUS_G3H = 8.59V
PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS = 8.59V
PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS = 8.59V
PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL=14.82V
PPDCIN_G3H = 14.82V
PP3V42_G3H = 3.418V
PPVRTC_G3H = 3.347V
PP5V_S5 = 5.022V
PP5V_S4RS3 = 0V
U7501 Pin 4 (P5VS4RS3_EN_R) = 0.190V
R8179 and R7551 have 0.002 resistance

According to schema PM_SLP_S4_L originates from U0500.
PM_SLP_S4_L = 0.190V
PM_SYSRST_L = 0V
PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK = 0V.

Need some direction or is this board toast?

threads.title: Macbook air 820-00165-A
threads.message:
Do you have original Magsafe 2 charger?

Check all PCH's RTC signals.
Also check PM_DSW_PWRGD and PCH_DSWVRMEN.

threads.title: Macbook air 820-00165-A
threads.message:
I do not have the original magsafe charger.

PCH_SRTCRST_L = 3.342v
PCH_INTVRMEN =3.25v
PM_DSW_PWRGD =3.4v
PCH_DSWVRMEN = 3.25v
PP3V3_S5 = 3.34v

threads.title: Macbook air 820-00165-A
threads.message:
RTC_RESET_L = 3.341v
PCH_SRTC_RST_L  = 3.341v  (the doc refered to "SRTC_RST_L". I assumed it was this one)
PCH_INTRUDER_L = 3.073v
PCH_INTVRMEN = 3.249v

threads.title: Macbook air 820-00165-A
threads.message:
Looks like PCH issue then.
Is PM_SLP_SUS_L high?

threads.title: Macbook air 820-00165-A
threads.message:
Any history available, liquid sign?

Heat CPU to 180-200 degrees, for 15-20s.
No need to melt the balls, just to burn eventually accumulated crap.

threads.title: Macbook air 820-00165-A
threads.message:
Tried to heat up CPU as instructed. Did not help.
Is it worth validating PCH is outputting correct frequencies?

Thank you for the help and guidance. Much appreciated!
